name: Discord
title: Discord

children.text: The Discord modules allow you to create, update, list, and/or delete channels, channel messages, reactions, and webhooks in your Discord account.
To get started with Discord, create an account at
, message content will be categorized as
This means that users who have installed our verified bot on their Discord server will not be able to use the following Make modules with the bot:
Users who installed the Make verified bot to connect to the Discord app on our platform will see the empty values of messages that the channel member sends for the fields,
The Make verified bot is still able to receive the messages for the above modules under the following conditions:
Messages the bot receives in DMs
Messages in which the bot is mentioned
If you want to use the aforementioned modules, you can
create a custom connection using a separate client ID
You can connect the Discord app to Make in two ways:

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Connect using OAuth2

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Connect using OAuth2 and using your own app credentials

children.text: Connect Discord to Make using OAuth2
To connect your Discord account to Make, you need to create a server and channels.
Login to your Discord account and create a server.
Enter the details of the server and click
Go to Make and open the Discord module's
Select the server created in step 1, allow the permissions for messages and channels, and click
You have successfully connected the Discord app and can now build Make.
Connect to Discord using OAuth2 and your own credentials
To connect to Discord, you need to create a developer account to obtain the bot token, client ID, and client secret values by creating a custom application from your Discord developer account.
, enter a name for the application, and click
, add the following redirect URIs, and click
value to a safe place. In the
, accept the warning, and copy the secret value to a safe place.
Optional: Change the default name of the bot.
settings if you want to receive full message content from all the modules.
to generate the bot token, accept the alert, and copy the bot token to a safe place as you can see the token only once.
Log in to your Make, add a module from the Discord app, click
field, enter a name for the connection.
field, enter the token copied in step 7.
fields, enter the values copied in step 4 in the respective fields, select the bot permissions, and click
Select the server to which you connect.
You have successfully the Discord bot to Make and can now access messages content.
You can watch, list, retrieve, send, edit, and delete messages with the following modules.
Triggers when a new message is posted to the channel.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the Channel ID whose message you want to watch.
The maximum number of channel messages Make should return during one Make execution cycle.
Returns the message for the channel.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the Channel ID whose messages you want to list.
The maximum number of messages Make should return during one Make execution cycle. The default value is 10.
Enter the User ID to list the channel messages before this user ID.
Returns a specific message in the channel.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the Channel ID whose messages you want to retrieve.
Select the Message ID whose details you want to retrieve.
Sends a message to a specified channel, thread, or guild member.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Send a Message to a Channel
Send a Message to a Thread
Send a DM (Direct Message) to a Guild Member
Select the Channel ID to send a message.
Enter the message you want to send.
Select whether the message is a TTS message.
Enter the details of embedded objects:
Enter the Embed's type. For example, rich, image, video, image, article, and link.
Enter the embed's timestamp in ISO8601 format. See the
list of supported date and time formats
Enter the Sticker ID to be sent along with the message.
Enter the components you want to send or respond to a slash command or other interaction. For field descriptions, see the
Enter the file name, including the extension, for example,
Enter the Message ID if you are replying to a message.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Send a Message to a Channel
Send a Message to a Thread
Send a DM (Direct Message) to a Guild Member
Select or map the Channel ID whose message you want to edit.
Select or map the Message ID whose details you want to edit.
Enter the message contents up to a maximum of 2000 characters.
Select a flag for the message. For field descriptions, see the
Enter the embeds you want to add to your message. For field descriptions, see the
Enter the components you want to send or respond to a slash command or other interaction. For field descriptions, see the
Enter the file name, including the extension, for example,

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Enter the Channel ID whose message you want to delete.
Enter the Message ID you want to delete.
You can watch, list, create, update, and delete channels, channel invites, and guild channels.
Triggers when a new channel invite is created.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the Channel ID whose channel invites you want to watch.
The maximum number of channel invites Make should return during one Make execution cycle. The default value is 2.
Returns a list of invites (with invite metadata) for the channel.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the Channel ID whose channel invite you want to list.
The maximum number of channel invites Make should return during one Make execution cycle. The default value is 10.
Returns a list of bot's channels.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: The maximum number of channels Make should return during one Make execution cycle. The default value is 10.
Select whether to list root channels.
Creates a new channel for the guild.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Enter a name for the guild channel.
Select the type of guild channel:
Enter the topic name for the guild channel.
Enter the sorting position of the guild channel.
Enter the number of seconds the user has to wait before sending the next message in the guild channel.
Select the Parent ID of the guild channel:
if this guild channel is NSFW (Not Suitable For Wumpus).
For more information on NSFW, see
Add the permission overwrites for the channel:
Select the Role ID of the user.
Enter the number of permission bit set to allow.
Enter the number of permission bit set to deny.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the Channel ID whose thread you want to create.
Select the Message ID whose thread you want to create.
Enter a name for the channel thread.
Select the duration to stop the thread from showing in the channel list:
Enter the number of seconds the user has to wait before sending the next message in the guild channel.
Creates a new invite for the channel. It works only with a connection that has permission to manage invites.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the Channel ID whose invite you want to create.
Enter the maximum duration after which the invite expires.
Enter the duration of the invite in seconds before expiry, or 0 for never. Note: 86400 is 24 hours.
Enter the maximum number of times the channel invite can be used.
Select if this channel invite gives a temporary membership.
Select if this channel invite can be used only once. If selected, you cannot create a similar channel invite.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Enter the Channel ID you want to modify.
Enter a new name for the channel.
Note: Only conversion between text and news is supported and only in guilds with the 'NEWS' feature.
Enter a topic for the channel.
Enter the channel sorting position of the guild channel.
Enter the time in seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600).
Select the Parent ID of the guild channel:
if this guild channel is NSFW (Not Suitable For Wumpus).
For more information on NSFW, see
Add the permissions for members to overwrite:
Select the role or members to whom you want to assign the permission.
Enter the permission allowed in a bit set.
Enter the permission denied in a bit set.
Enter the bitrate (in bits) if this is a voice channel.
Enter the maximum number of users you can add to the channel.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the Channel ID you want to delete.
You can post a reaction with emojis with the following module.
Post a Reaction with an Emoji
Post a reaction for the message with an emoji.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the Channel ID where you want to post a reaction with an emoji.
Enter the Message ID that you want to post a reaction with an emoji.
Enter the emoji to post as a reaction to the message.
You can watch, search, list and update guild members and add or remove roles from guild members with the following modules.
Triggers when a member has joined the bot's guild.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: The maximum number of guild members Make should return during one Make execution cycle. The default value is 2.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Enter a username or a nickname to return the guild members.
The maximum number of guild members Make should return during one Make execution cycle. The default value is 10.
Returns a list of members that are members of the bot's guild.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Enter the User ID to list the guild member after this ID.
The maximum number of Guild Members Make should return during one Make execution cycle.
List Guild Members with Reactions on Message
Returns a list of guide member that reacted with the emoji on the message.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Get a Message from a Channel
Get a Message from a Thread
Get a DM (Direct Message) from a Guild Member
Select the Channel ID whose users reacted with an emoji you want to list.
Select the Message ID that has the reaction with an emoji that you want to list the users of.
Enter the Guild member whose reaction to the message you want to list. Alternatively, you can search for guild members.
Enter a username or nickname to list the guild members with the string.
The maximum number of guild members Make: Product name should return during one Make: scenario execution cycle. The default value is 10.
Select the emoji you want to list.
The maximum number of users Make should return during one Make execution cycle.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Enter the Guild member whose reaction to the message you want to list. Alternatively, you can search for guild members.
Enter a username or nickname to list the guild members with the string.
The maximum number of guild members Make: Product name should return during one Make: scenario execution cycle. The default value is 10.
Enter a nickname for the guild member.
Select the Role ID to assign them to the guild member.
Select whether the user is muted in voice channels.
Select whether the user is deafened in voice channels.
Select the Channel ID to move the user.
Enter the timeout, after which the user can communicate in the guild again (up to 28 days in the future), and set it to null to remove the timeout.
Add a Role to a Guild Member
Adds a Role to a Guild Member.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the User ID whose role you want to add to a guild member.
Select the Role ID of the user you want to add.
Remove a Role from a Guild Member
Removes a role from a guild member,

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the User ID whose role you want to remove from a guild member.
Select the Role ID of the user you want to remove.
You can create, update, list, retrieve, and delete guild events with the following modules.
Retrieves a list of scheduled events for guild.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Include number of users subscribed to each event
Select whether to list the users subscribed to each event.
The maximum number of guild members Make should return during one Make execution cycle. The default value is 10.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select or map the Guild Event ID whose details you want to retrieve.
Include number of users subscribed to each event
Select whether to retrieve the users subscribed to each event.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Enter a name for the event.
Enter the event's location. This field is required if the event type is
Enter the Channel ID whose event you want to create. This field is required if the event type is
Enter a time when the event is scheduled to start in ISO8601 format.
Enter a time when the event is scheduled to end in ISO8601 format.
Enter a description for the event.
Enter the file name, including its extension. For example, invoice.xml.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select or map the Guild Event ID whose details you want to update.
Enter a name for the event.
Enter the event's location. This field is required if the event type is
Enter the Channel ID whose event you want to create. This field is required if the event type is
Enter a time when the event is scheduled to start in ISO8601 format. See the

data.label: list of supported date and time formats
data.overridedLabel: list of supported date and time formats

children.text: list of supported date and time formats
Enter a time when the event is scheduled to end in ISO8601 format. See the

data.label: list of supported date and time formats
data.overridedLabel: list of supported date and time formats

children.text: list of supported date and time formats
Enter a description for the event.
Enter the file name, including its extension. For example,

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select or map the Guild Event ID you want to delete.
You can create, send messages, and delete webhook bots with the following modules.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the Channel ID whose webhook you want to create.
Enter a name for the webhook bot.
Send a Message by Webhook Bot
Sends a new message by executing a (custom) webhook bot.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Select the Channel ID whose webhook you want to execute.
Enter the webhook name you want to execute.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Enter the Webhook ID you want to delete.
You can update current bots and call APIs with the following modules.
Updates a current and connected user's bot.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: Enter a name for the bot.
Performs an arbitrary authorized API call to manage data in Discord.

data.label: Discord
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Discord App account.

children.text: For the list of available endpoints, refer to the
Select the HTTP method you want to use:
to retrieve information for an entry.
to make a partial entry update.
Enter the desired request headers. You don't have to add authorization headers; we already did that for you.
Select the method in which you want to map the body content.
Enter the body content for your API call.
The following API call returns all the information about the selected user:
Matches of the search can be found in the module's
In our example, the details of the user were returned:

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
